inputs.name: source
inputs.label: Source path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the base directory for all source globbing patterns.

inputs.name: target
inputs.label: Target path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the directory to which ClickOnce packages will be published. If a relative path is specified, it will be relative to the Source directory. This directory will be automatically excluded from all source globbing patterns.

inputs.name: product
inputs.label: Application name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the name of the application. This name is used for the shortcut name on the Start menu and is part of the name that appears in the Add or Remove Programs dialog box.

inputs.name: version
inputs.label: Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the version of the deployment. This need not be (and usually isn't) the same as the version of the application. Must be a dotted version number with 1 to 4 elements, each less than 63356. If not specified, the version number of the EntryPoint is used.

inputs.name: publisher
inputs.label: Publisher
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the publisher of the application. This name is used for the folder name on the Start menu and is part of the name that appears in the Add or Remove Programs dialog box.

inputs.name: launchMode
inputs.label: Launch mode
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies whether the application can be launched from the Start menu, from a URL, or both. Also allows browser-hosted deployments (Internet Explorer only).

options.url: Launchable from a URL (Internet Explorer / Edge only)
options.both: Launchable from Start menu or a URL

inputs.name: createDesktopShortcut
inputs.label: Create desktop shortcut
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies whether a shortcut to the application should be added to the user's desktop.

inputs.name: createAutoRun
inputs.label: Create autorun.inf file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies whether or not to create an autorun.inf to launch the ClickOnce installer when deployed to removable media.

inputs.name: useDeployExtension
inputs.label: Use .deploy extension
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies whether the .deploy file name extension mapping is used. If this parameter is true, every program file is published with a .deploy file name extension. This option is useful for web server security to limit the number of file name extensions that must be unblocked to enable ClickOnce application deployment.

inputs.name: trustUrlParameters
inputs.label: Trust URL parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies whether URL query-string parameters should be made available to the application.

inputs.name: deploymentUrl
inputs.label: Deployment URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the URL that will be used to distribute and update the application. Must be a valid and absolute URI (a URL or a UNC).

inputs.name: description
inputs.label: Description
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies a description for the application.

inputs.name: suite
inputs.label: Suite
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the name of the suite to which the application belongs. If specified, this determines the folder on the Start menu where the application is located after deployment.

inputs.name: culture
inputs.label: Culture
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the culture of the application. Must be 'neutral' or a valid culture (e.g. 'en-GB'). If not specified, the culture of the EntryPoint is used.

inputs.name: errorUrl
inputs.label: Error URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the URL of the web page that is displayed in dialog boxes during ClickOnce installation. Must be a valid and absolute URI (a URL or a UNC).

inputs.name: supportUrl
inputs.label: Support URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the URL of the web page that is displayed in the Add or Remove Programs dialog box for the application. Must be a valid and absolute URI (a URL or a UNC).

inputs.name: targetFramework
inputs.label: Target framework
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the target framework of the application.

inputs.name: entryPoint
inputs.label: Entry point
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the application assembly that starts when the application is run. Must be an .exe file. If this is not a .Net Framework assembly, a launcher must be used via the UseLauncher option. If not specified, the source directory is recursively searched for .exe files. If exactly one is found, it will be assigned to be the entry point.

inputs.name: iconFile
inputs.label: Icon file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the application icon file. This is used for the Start Menu and Add/Remove Programs dialog. Must be an .ico file. If not specified, the source directory is recursively searched for .ico files. If exactly one is found it is used; otherwise, a default icon is used.

inputs.name: deploymentPage
inputs.label: Deployment page
inputs.helpMarkdown: Specifies the name of the deployment page to create. If not specified, no deployment page will be created.

inputs.name: assemblies
inputs.label: Assemblies
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies a list of globbing patterns to match assemblies to be included. Will only consider managed assemblies, hence a pattern of *.dll will exclude native libraries.

inputs.name: dataFiles
inputs.label: Data files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies a list of globbing patterns to match data files to be included. Will not include any files already added as assemblies. These files are considered mutable, and can be migrated between application versions.

inputs.name: files
inputs.label: Files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies a list of globbing patterns to match non-assembly files to be included.  Will not include any files already added as assemblies or data files.

inputs.name: optionalFilesPath
inputs.label: Optional files path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies a path under which optional files are stored, relative to the source path. The first level of directories under this path will be used as the group names for the optional download groups. The DataFiles glob will be ignored for this path, as data files cannot be optional.

inputs.name: prerequisitesMode
inputs.label: Download mode
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the location that prerequisites should be downloaded from

inputs.name: prerequisitesUrl
inputs.label: Download URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the location to download prerequisites from.

inputs.name: prerequisite1
inputs.label: Prerequisite
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies a prerequisite to install

options.Microsoft.VSTORuntime.4.0: Microsoft Visual Studio 2010 Tools for Office Runtime (x86 and x64)
Microsoft System CLR Types for SQL Server 2014 (x64)
Microsoft System CLR Types for SQL Server 2014 (x86)

inputs.name: extension1
inputs.label: Extension
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the file extension. Include the leading dot.

inputs.name: extension1Description
inputs.label: Description
inputs.helpMarkdown: Specifies a description for the file extension

inputs.name: extension1ProgId
inputs.label: ProgId
inputs.helpMarkdown: Specifies the ProgId for the file extension

inputs.name: extension1Icon
inputs.label: Default icon
inputs.helpMarkdown: Specifies a default icon for the file extension

inputs.name: updateMode
inputs.label: Update mode
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies how application updates should be deployed.

inputs.name: updateInterval
inputs.label: Interval
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the update interval.

inputs.name: updateUnit
inputs.label: Unit
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the update unit.

inputs.name: minimumVersion
inputs.label: Minimum version
inputs.helpMarkdown: Specifies the minimum version the user must update to when starting the application. Must be a dotted version number with 1 to 4 elements, each less than 63356. Must be equal to or lower than Version. If not specified and UpdateMode is not 'none', defaults to Version.
inputs.visibleRule: updateMode = starting || updateMode = started || updateMode = scheduled

inputs.name: signingMode
inputs.label: Signing mode
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the signing mode to be applied.

inputs.name: thumbprint
inputs.label: Thumbprint
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the thumbprint of the installed certificate.

inputs.name: certificate
inputs.label: Certificate
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the certificate to use. Add this as a secure file.

inputs.name: certificatePassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the password for the certificate. To secure this value, set it up as a variable and lock it with the padlock.

inputs.name: timestampUrl
inputs.label: Timestamp URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the URL of a server to timestamp the signature.

inputs.name: trustMode
inputs.label: Trust level
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the level of trust to grant. If using a launcher, this must be set to Full Trust.

inputs.name: sameSite
inputs.label: Grant the application access to its site of origin
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies whether the application can access services hosted at the URL it is deployed to.

inputs.name: trustFile
inputs.label: Custom trust file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies an XML file which contains custom trust info. This should be the <trustInfo> element from a manifest file.

inputs.name: useApplicationTrust
inputs.label: Use application trust
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies which manifest should be used for trust decisions. If true, the Product, Publisher, and SupportUrl properties are written to the application manifest; otherwise, they are written to the deployment manifest.

inputs.name: identity
inputs.label: Identity
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the identity name of the application. This is used for the application and deployment manifest file names and the package folder name. If not specified, a name is inferred from the EntryPoint.

inputs.name: deploymentPageTemplate
inputs.label: Deployment page template
inputs.helpMarkdown: Specifies the template to use to create the deployment page. Must end in '.htm' or '.html'. If not specified, a default deployment page template will be used.

inputs.name: minimumOs
inputs.label: Minimum OS
inputs.helpMarkdown: Specifies the minimum OS version required by the application. If you require specific service pack levels, select Custom.

inputs.name: osVersion
inputs.label: OS Version
inputs.helpMarkdown: Specifies the minimum required operating system (OS) version required by the application. For example, the value '5.1.2600.0' indicates the operating system is Windows XP. Must be a dotted version number with 2 to 4 elements. The first 2 elements must match a known Windows version (e.g. '6.0' for Windows Vista)

inputs.name: osDescription
inputs.label: OS Description
inputs.helpMarkdown: Specifies a description of the OS Version.

inputs.name: useLauncher
inputs.label: Launcher
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies whether or not a launcher should be created.

options.auto: Create a launcher if the entry point is not a .Net Framework assembly

inputs.name: verbosity
inputs.label: Verbosity
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the level of logging to emit
